scenarioDescription:
The HD 99492 Exoplanetary System


Overview

HD 99492 is a star with 0.48 times the mass of the Sun, and 0.83 times its radius. It is located 59.37 light years away from the solar system and is estimated to be 4.8 billion years old, as compared to the Sun which is roughly 4.6 billion years old.

HD 99492 is known to have 1 exoplanets in orbit around it.


Exoplanets in the HD 99492 system


HD 99492 b

HD 99492 b was discovered by the W. M. Keck Observatory observatory, in 2005-01, using the radial velocity method. Its semi-major axis is 0.12 astronomical units, as compared to Earth's which is 1 astronomical unit. The mass of HD 99492 b is 22.260 times the mass of Earth. The radius of HD 99492 b is 5.020 that of Earth. At more than 10 Earth masses, HD 99492 b is an ice giant, a planet that is made up mostly of volatiles like water, amonia and methane, and enveloped by a dense hydrogen and helium atmosphere, much like Uranus and Neptune in our solar system.
description: 3D visualisation and gravity simulation of the exoplanet system HD 99492, which contains 1 exoplanets and was discovered by the W. M. Keck Observatory.
name: HD 99492 - System With 1 Exoplanet
